1. Weigh each material accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine 240 g of Boron, 160 g of Cobalt, 8 g of Lithium, and 32 g of Manganese. 3. steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the solid sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
